perturbation.changed_text:
11.1 Term. The term of this Agreement shall automatically become effective upon the occurrence of (i) ETON executing a commercial
supply agreement with a contract manufacturing organization within forty-five (45) days of the Execution Date, provided that ETON has exercised
best efforts to execute such agreement and the failure to execute is solely caused by the refusal or inability of the proposed manufacturing
organization to sign a reasonable agreement; and (ii) acceptance for review of the Dossier or marketing application for [ * * * ] by the FDA no later
than September 2, 2019 (such date, the “Effective Date”) and shall end upon the termination or expiration of the Agreement as set forth in Section
11 (the “Term”). For avoidance of doubt, all rights conferred to ETON under this Agreement for the purpose of allowing ETON to Market the
Product in the Territory shall cease immediately upon termination of this Agreement by either party. Aucta's right to receive 15% of Net Sales Royalty shall continue indefinitely, even after termination of this Agreement, regardless of whether ETON continues selling the Product(s) in the Territory. The obligations of ETON to consummate
the transactions contemplated by this Agreement shall be subject to the fulfillment or ETON’s waiver of the occurrence of the Effective Date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that all rights conferred to ETON continue until termination of the agreement, with Aucta receiving royalties as long as ETON sells the product unless otherwise agreed. The modification directly contradicts this by stating ETON's rights cease immediately upon termination, but Aucta continues to receive royalties even after termination. This creates uncertainty about the duration of rights and royalty obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
11.2 Termination for Breach. The Agreement may be terminated by either Party by written notice to the other at any time if the other Party
(the “Breaching Party”) is in material breach or default of any of its obligations hereunder or any of its representations or warranties as follows: (i)
the terminating Party shall send a written notice of the material breach or material default to the Breaching Party and (ii) the termination shall
become effective a) thirty (30) days after sending notice of the breach if the breach is non-payment of amounts due hereunder, such as milestone,
minimum royalty or royalties amounts and b) sixty (60) days after sending notice of the breach for all other breaches unless the Breaching Party has
cured any such material breach or material default prior to the expiration of the thirty (30) or sixty (60) day period as the case may be; or if for non-
payment breaches such material default or material breach is not capable of being cured within such sixty (60) day period and the Breaching Party
has commenced activities reasonably expected to cure such material breach or material default within such sixty (60) day period and thereafter uses
diligent efforts to complete the cure as soon as practicable, but in no event shall such period exceed ninety (90) days.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.2 Termination for Breach. The Agreement may be terminated by either Party by written notice to the other at any time if the other Party
(the “Breaching Party”) is in material breach or default of any of its obligations hereunder or any of its representations or warranties as follows: (i)
the terminating Party shall send a written notice of the material breach or material default to the Breaching Party and (ii) the termination shall
become effective immediately upon sending the notice of breach, regardless of the type of breach or whether the Breaching Party has cured or intends to cure the breach. The terminating party can waive the breach after sending the notice, if they so choose, but the termination is effective immediately.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows a cure period for breaches before termination is effective. The modified text contradicts this by stating termination is effective immediately upon notice, regardless of cure, creating ambiguity about the breaching party's rights and obligations.

perturbation.changed_text:
13.1 Aucta’s Indemnification Obligations. Aucta shall indemnify, defend and hold ETON and its owners, officers, directors, Affiliates, and
employees (collectively, “ETON Indemnified Parties”) harmless from and against any and all Losses arising out of or resulting from any Third
Party Claims made or suits brought against ETON Indemnified Parties which arise or result from (i) Aucta’s breach of any of its
representations, warranties or covenants set forth in this Agreement, or any of its obligations hereunder; (ii) Aucta’s manufacture, registration,
handling, storage, use, transportation of any Product on or after the Effective Date, including, without limitation, any Claim for personal injury or
death, to the extent such Third Party Claims arise from the period of time commencing on or after the Effective Date irrespective of whether such is
attributable to ETON’s breach of this Agreement or any Applicable Laws; or (iii) Aucta’s negligence or willful misconduct with regard to the
Products irrespective of whether such is attributable to ETON’s breach of this Agreement or any Applicable Laws.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause limits Aucta's indemnification obligations by excluding claims attributable to ETON's breach or applicable laws. The modified clause removes "material" before breach to increase the types of breaches indemnifiable. More importantly, it eliminates the exclusions regarding ETON's breach or applicable laws, meaning Aucta would have to indemnify ETON even when ETON's actions contribute to the loss. This creates a contradiction because under the original wording the allocation of risk was clearer and under the new wording it is not clear what ETONs liability is.
